com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications

Class PopOverComposite

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications.PopOverShell
        • com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications.PopOverComposite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FadeEffect.Fadeable

    public class PopOverComposite
extends PopOverShell
    A PopOverShell used to display an arbitrary Composite over a Control or CustomElementDataProvider. 
       Most commonly, you'll use PopOverComposite like this:
   
     Button button = new Button(shell, SWT.PUSH);
     PopOverComposite popOverComposite = PopOverComposite.createPopOverComposite(button);
     Composite composite = new Composite(popOverComposite.getPopOverCompositeShell, SWT.NONE);
     // add components to the composite
     popOverComposite.setComposite(composite);
     button.addSelectionListener(new SelectionAdapter() {
       public void widgetSelected(SelectionEvent e) {
         popOverComposite.toggle();
       }
     });
